vectorData.altText:
That's right!  Groove A is created by the aorta. The superior impression indicates the location of the aortic arch, which continues as thoracic aorta inferiorly. 
Note: You can determine the side of the lung by identifying the number of lobes.
That is incorrect. Click here     to learn the answer, then come back to try again.
Identify, on its mediastinal aspect, impressions left by the:

Adjacent mediastinal structures leave contact impressions on the mediastinal surfaces of the lungs. By studying these contact impressions, you gain a better understanding of the relative positions of structures within the thorax.

heart, the cardiac impression
esophagus, the esophageal impression
azygous vein
SVC
Identify, on its mediastinal aspect, impressions left by the:

heart, the cardiac impression
aortic arch 
thoracic aorta
